title: Euromore, Russia's new information warfare weapon
summary: Organizations close to the Kremlin have funded the creation of a news website intended to take over from Russian state-run media outlets RT and Sputnik, which have been banned in Europe since the invasion of Ukraine.

title: Rugby: Dupont guides France to Sevens glory
summary: High expectations on the France rugby sevens side for its Paris home Olympics were elevated after it won its first world series title in Madrid on Sunday. The French team outmuscled Argentina in the final 19-5.World Series

title: South Africa: The ANC's historically low score signals the end of its political dominance
summary: For the first time since the end of apartheid, Nelson Mandela's party will have to join forces with its main rivals to stay in power, against a backdrop of rising populism in the country.

title: Ruling populists declare victory in Serbia local vote despite opposition claims of irregularities
summary: The victory claim, which was likely to be confirmed by the state electoral commission, would cement the right-wing Serbian Progressive Party's hold on power in the country that is a candidate nation for EU membership. Election observers filed several criminal complaints over suspected organized voting and vote-buying.

title: From the humble tea seller to the religious leader, Narendra Modi's transformations to win over the Indians
summary: From modest origins and hailing from a village in Gujarat, the prime minister has gradually built a reputation as a man of the people who can surpass caste divisions.

title: French Open 2024: Dimitrov vs. Sinner and Alcaraz vs. Tsitsipas in quarters
summary: Dimitrov eliminated No. 8 Hubert Hurkacz, and Australian Open champion Sinner recovered from a terrible start to beat unseeded Corentin Moutet on Sunday. Alcaraz, a two-time major champion, defeated No. 21 Felix Auger-Aliassime, and Tsitsipas, a two-time Grand Slam runner-up, came back to eliminate unseeded Matteo Arnaldi.

title: Trump joins TikTok, app he once tried to ban
summary: Two days after being found guilty on felony charges, Donald Trump published his first video on the app, of him at a UFC fight.

title: Zelensky accuses China of 'working hard to prevent' countries from attending peace summit
summary: As Ukraine's president urged countries to participate in the conference, China said it should have 'equal participation' and 'recognition' of Ukraine and Russia.

title: EU elections: Macron's coalition tries to remotivate members at last major rally
summary: Several figures from the presidential bloc, including Prime Minister Gabriel Attal, took to the stage on Saturday near Paris to support their lead candidate Valérie Hayer, a week before the European election.

title: Joe Biden, trapped by his support for Israel, seeks a way to end war in Gaza
summary: On Friday, the American president presented a three-phase plan for a ceasefire. Hamas has described the proposal as 'positive.'

title: South Africa's president urges parties to find common ground in talks after election deadlock
summary: The governing African National Congress lost its 30-year-old majority, with only 159 seats out of 400. It will need to agree on a coalition with another party or parties for the first time to co-govern.

title: Yet again, French Open fails to fill gaping holes of empty hospitality seats
summary: Like in recent years,  the empty boxes on the center court at the Parisian tournament are a source of controversy. Organizers seem powerless to fix the problem.

title: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico's likely feminist-in-chief
summary: On June 2, the left-wing former mayor of Mexico City is expected to win Mexico's presidential election. At 61, Sheinbaum is buoyed by her advocacy actions for women's rights, in a country where the number of femicides has reached record highs.

title: Kylian Mbappé wore the PSG shirt for the last time. Does anyone care?
summary: The footballer ended his adventure with the Parisian club with a victory in the French Cup final at Villeneuve-d'Ascq on May 25. Emmanuel Macron naturally jumped at the chance.

title: In Sweden, the far right makes the political debate Trump-esque
summary: An investigative program has revealed that the Sweden Democrats party has been spreading disinformation via anonymous accounts. Party boss Jimmie Akesson has counter-attacked by denouncing an influencing campaign against his movement.

title: 2024 US presidential election: 'The current electoral system encourages doubt and controversy over results'
summary: Some states have signed a pact that would prevent a candidate from being declared the winner of the presidential election without a majority.

title: Female Moroccan minister summoned to talk about her private life
summary: Leila Benali, in charge of the country's energy transition, is suspected of a conflict of interest due to an alleged relationship with the founder of an Australian mining group. Feminists argue her treatment differs from that reserved for men.

title: In the UK, Nigel Farage hopes to win back disappointed Conservatives
summary: The former leader of the Brexit Party – now renamed Reform UK – is focusing his campaign for the July 4 snap general election on the issue of migration. Polls are giving his party 8% to 14% of the vote.

title: Euro 2024: 'I'm Lilian's son, but above all, I'm Marcus Thuram'
summary: After a successful season with Inter Milan, the eldest son of the 1998 world champion has been included in Didier Deschamps' list of 25 players selected for the 2024 European championships.
